strapiPost.title: Fayetteville Mayor Lioneld Jordan Delivers State Of The City Address
strapiPost.content:
On Feb 2, Mayor Lioneld Jordan delivered the 2023 State of the City address to the Fayetteville community, recognizing the city's accomplishments and casting vision for the future.

  • Looking back: Describing the city's state as "sound," Mayor Jordan called attention to the city's accomplishments in infrastructure, the economy, and the environment, giving credit to the public service workers who have contributed to the city's growth.
  • Looking out: Jordan called for a more substantial investment toward affordable housing options for the city's at-risk residents, balancing the remaining portions of American Rescue Plan funding between amenities that would benefit all residents and those supporting our most vulnerable neighbors.

Read NWA Democrat Gazette's summary of the address HERE.
